reasoningQuestions.questionText: A simple pendulum with length $!$L$!$ performs simple harmonic motion on Earth, crossing its equilibrium position $!$60$!$ times in one minute. The same pendulum is then transported to Planet X where its time period is found to be $!$8.0$!$ seconds. Calculate the approximate value of gravitational acceleration on Planet X (up to 2 decimal place). Assume that the gravitational acceleration on Earth is $!$9.8 m/s^2$!$.
